snippet: The offensive provided the latest evidence of the militants’ strength in Iraq, six months after hard-line Islamist fighters seized the western city of Falluja.
abstract: Hundreds of Sunni militants storm central Iraqi city of Samarra, taking control of neighborhoods and government buildings; siege provokes panicked government counteroffensive to prevent loss of town; militants raise flag of Islamic State of Iraq and Syria over buildings.

byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Tikrit, Iraq.

lead_paragraph: The offensive provided the latest evidence of the militants’ strength in Iraq, six months after hard-line Islamist fighters seized the western city of Falluja.

headline.main: In Brazen Strike, Sunni Militants Storm Central Iraqi City
headline.print_headline: In Brazen Strike, Sunni Militants Storm Central Iraqi City

keywords.value: Islamic State of Iraq and Syria
keywords.name: organizations
